page.title: 02Local History.Fareham.
page.content: High Street is a delightful reminder of the past with many fine Georgian and Victorian buildings.At the bottom of the street is the Red Lion an old coaching inn.This opens into West Street which is very wide and now a pedestrian prescinct.In the last century it was the market place with a mixture of animals and stalls of all kinds. The shopping prescinct is now on one side of the street and a large department store is due to replace the old buildings on the other side of the street. Further developments are due very shortly and one listed building which will remain is Westbury Manor.This was used as council offices until two years ago,and is provisionally earmarked as the museum for the town.
